body:
Problem: Significant code duplication between the two command parsing functions

Solution: Extract shared parsing logic into helper functions while preserving original behavior

comment_data.body: This is specific to the `nvim_parse_cmd` API. `do_one_cmd()` already sets a different `nextcmd`.
Extracting this function seem to make code less readable, considering that it's just two function calls.
Okay reverted the extraction. revisit it during the future refactor ðŸ˜Š

this name is a  bit misleading.

```suggestion
static void parse_bang(exarg_T *eap, char **p)
```
this is more readable, let's use this impl
What is the point of using `char **p` here when you have moved `(*p)++` outside?
oh right .. don't move it now inside now..
no, i mean use this code in `parse_bang`

title: refactor: extract common logic from parse_cmdline and do_one_cmd
